message.content:
cs.CV, cs.RO, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.MM. 

The paper focuses on optical flow extraction for visual applications such as tracking, activity detection, and recognition, which are all related to computer vision (cs.CV). The proposed method also involves variational refinement, which is a common technique in robotics (cs.RO) for improving the accuracy of visual odometry and motion estimation. Additionally, the use of patch aggregation and inverse search techniques suggests that the method may also be relevant to machine learning (cs.AI) and deep learning (cs.LG) for feature extraction and matching. Finally, the paper mentions the use of optical flow for motion estimation in video (cs.MM), which further supports the relevance of this work to multiple arXiv CS sub-categories.
